EXTRACTED VALUE: Greg Monroe played 27 minutes and hit 3-of-6 shots for six points, two rebounds, four assists and a steal on Friday.
Paul Millsap played through the flu Friday and had 12 points, seven rebounds and three blocks.
Ben Wallace had four points, 11 rebounds, one assist, four steals and a block in Tuesday's preseason win.
Jeff Foster made his season debut on Thursday, playing 12 minutes off the bench to score two points with four rebounds and two blocks.
Celtics forward Luke Harangody officially signed his rookie-scale contract on Tuesday.
Paul George came off the bench to hit 6-of-11 shots and five 3-pointers for 17 points and five rebounds in Tuesday's OT win.
Jordan Crawford got the call at backup PG on Saturday during the second half, as Jeff Teague was ineffective during the first half.
Quincy Pondexter was taken by the Thunder with the 26th pick on Thursday, but will be sent to the Hornets.
Delonte West underwent successful wrist surgery Tuesday.
D.J. White double-doubled with 12 points, 13 rebounds and two blocks in a start for Thunder on Tuesday.
Josh Howard (knee) is still weeks away from returning to action as he recovers from major reconstructive knee surgery.
Von Wafer has signed a fully guaranteed, one-year deal with the Celtics for the veteran's minimum.
Knicks coach Mike D'Antoni confirmed that Anthony Randolph might not crack the rotation in the near future.
Francisco Garcia practiced Monday after missing two games due to the flu.
Chris Kaman will not play on Monday against the Kings, and will have an MRI taken Tuesday to determine how bad he re-injured it during Sunday's game.

James Posey is expected to be Josh McRoberts' backup at power forward.

The Knicks could end up starting Roger Mason at shooting guard and Amare Stoudemire at center.
Andrew Bynum went through Monday's entire practice and didn't report any problems or issues with his surgically repaired knee.
The NBA is in the advanced stages of a plan to purchase the Hornets from current owner George Shinn, according to Fanhouse.com.
Wayne Ellington returned from a thigh injury Wednesday and had zero points in three minutes.
DeSagana Diop lost 15 pounds this summer in an effort to get back in the rotation.

The Rockets are drawing interest from around the league for Jared Jeffries and his expiring contract.
Kelenna Azubuike went through a 5-on-5 scrimmage with the Knicks on Monday, though it's still unclear when he'll make his season debut.
Josh Childress, who is just 0-of-4 from downtown this season, may soon play some PF off the Suns bench.
Melvin Ely started in place of injured Nene on Friday and had five points and eight boards in 30 minutes.

Raja Bell is in the starting lineup for the Jazz after missing a game with a thigh injury.
Jason Kapono was excused from practice on Sunday for personal reasons.

Craig Smith hit 8-of-9 shots for 18 points and four rebounds in Friday's loss.
Wes Johnson, who is bothered by the flu, says he really wants to play on Monday at New York, and plans on doing so.

Leandro Barbosa hit 7-of-12 shots and two 3-pointers for 22 points and two steals in Friday's win.
